Posted By: LordOfTheFlies87 (5/3/2012 12:19:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
With a real lack of elemental support (Especially in blue) this card is the dreaded 'strictly worse' option for [Serra Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Sphinx) these days. Poor cloud man has really seen better days.  
  
The issue here is that for five mana your flier is still not going to compete with whatever Other colors can do. White has [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), Red has [Voracious Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voracious Dragon), Black has [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp)... I mean [Bloodgift Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodgift Demon)! Even green has the Not-technically-worse (But lovably censored) [\*\*\*atrice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=***atrice). All with pretty much the equivalent mana costs.   
  
Maybe its not fair to compare a bunch of rares to an uncommon, but blue was supposed to be flying king. He might still be, but not because of this guy.
posts.html:
With a real lack of elemental support (Especially in blue) this card is the dreaded 'strictly worse' option for Serra Sphinx these days. Poor cloud man has really seen better days.

The issue here is that for five mana your flier is still not going to compete with whatever Other colors can do. White has Baneslayer Angel, Red has Voracious Dragon, Black has Chimney Imp... I mean Bloodgift Demon! Even green has the Not-technically-worse (But lovably censored) ***atrice. All with pretty much the equivalent mana costs.

Maybe its not fair to compare a bunch of rares to an uncommon, but blue was supposed to be flying king. He might still be, but not because of this guy.

posts.post_content:
It's funny how back in the day, this was a very good card. Today, not so much. And there was a time when we thought that WOTC was watering down the game with the later expansions starting with, I'd say, Fallen Empires. But of late, the cards they're putting out are incredible. Sure, there will never be cards as powerful as the P9, but you can't play them in standard tournaments anyway so what does it matter?  
  
Yeah Air Elemental...you were great at one time but that was a long time ago.
